jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

AFA023AEE92F466189EE79BCE559BB99.description: Recognize that some words are fingerspelled due to domainspecific definition (e.g., H2O – fs-H-Y-D-R-O-G-E-N fs-O-X-ID-E).

DC06B6B19C7A4ED5BB6CFD9BE8D01CFA.description:
Recognize that some signs are compounded with signs
and lexicalized fingerspelling (e.g., #SUN+GLASSES,
BACK+#YARD).

CD04637054ED4F198EAC311F359C77EA.description:
Fingerspell longer words and phrases following correct
contour as new ASL and English lexicon expands.

63C2C4AD808A4401807EF78791430F51.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

EB51D70AF61E40C7B7BCFC57FEBEBEE8.description:
Connect initialized forms and alphabet letters to their
equivalent in English.

0C821388EC4A4AD5BF20D896C228ADC2.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

10DF533A0DD54141AA561A1972CF35C3.description:
Understand that fingerspelling can use space to establish
referents and/or to clarify meaning.

D8A5E5571A624D75948AB918CF6AAEE2.description:
Recognize that fingerspelled words are not always for
emphasis and use both the fingerspelled word and the sign
interchangeably (e.g., fs-O-N-L-I-N-E/ONLINE).

1E84B36416C54DEDB4ACE01AB1617FF4.description:
Use fingerspelled words when there are no sign equivalents
(e.g., proper nouns, technology terms, vegetables).

E9E53B19753848B3868D73F020E07BA7.description:
Use pacing in fingerspelling to highlight a phrase in
presentation or discourse for emphasis (e.g., E-V-O-L-V-E-D,
B-A-W-L-E-D #EYES O-U-T).

D028526623D847468074F9CE973B6A2E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of ways fingerspelled signs are
formed and their uses.

A08CB43B72E24A399A623AE2B9B46D74.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general
academic and domain-specific signs, fingerspelled words, and
phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and
other logical relationships (e.g., UNDERSTAND++, BUT, B-U-T,
#BUT, CAN, RESULT-WHAT-Q).

CB9209EC13084492B7C584B8CBD6FBEE.description:
Interpret sentences that use the same signs and different
expressions and tones to reflect different shades of
meaning.

376939D57DE649C99751EB8461737C26.description:
Use the relationship between particular signs (e.g.,
synonyms, antonyms, homonyms [HUNGRY/WISH]) to
better understand each of the signs.

00F13E79E40B43CAA8DCEDF8CFFF85DF.description:
Interpret figurative language, including similes and
metaphors, in context.

9AE21BFDE23A46B588780913669D754E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, sign
relationships, and nuances in sign meanings.

92EAD604151D4C36B1E34B3EE1451159.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the production
of and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key signs
and phrases.

B1BB87D19CC94CBB816BF3DB5CC05636.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate prefixes, suffixes, nonmanual markers, and iconicity of signs as clues to the
meaning of a sign.

253906A43AED4901A6CE9C84B80C235E.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and
comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a sign,
fingerspelled word, or phrase.

5FBC84BD7E854472A3FD7122786799E1.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases based on
grade 5 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from a range
of strategies.

D30F8E8B46524E88AA1C3DF895FDEBA1.description:
Combine and contrast the varieties of ASL (e.g., regional
accents, registers) used in stories, dramas, or poems.

C60FB2ADFF6D445BA59501B029352758.description:
Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning,
viewer interest, and style.

B1C907836DEA457C9F03C44610C2142D.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

C4977ECC69C2499DAB47C1D57E693FB9.description:
Demonstrate command of the structure of standard ASL
grammar and usage when signing (live and published).

5541919F18524B31BC1BF82C95573671.description:
Adapt sign to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal ASL
when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 5 Language
standards 1)

99F291A5DF8048FEAF948E8CA3B177E5.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, animation)
and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to
enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

7D004DDB02B849B58C218ECE58D7AD54.description:
Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing
ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant,
descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; sign
clearly at an understandable pace.

980F359757C64419B0C74D372474ADB5.description:
Summarize the points a signer makes and explain how each
claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

176F0D5D29CE44DEA5428747629504DD.description:
Summarize a text signed or information presented in diverse
media and formats, live or published, including those with
visual or quantitative information.

238CE75ADD34473F9707B441F512FB16.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions
in light of information and knowledge gained from the
discussions.

B838837206F4433FAACD8F9D95EF6124.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions by making
comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate
on the remarks of others.

3594D05170FE4B8C821F1AF590AFCAC0.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out
assigned roles.

8CA5EF13AEDE45E2AF0D01131F2A9019.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having viewed or studied
required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and
other information known about the topic to explore ideas
under discussion.

A95CADFA6F3C430787F184F1679A18C4.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g.,
one-on-one, in groups, teacher- led) with diverse partners
on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

1857A463B89345CA95CF27A8940B3D42.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (e.g.,
a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

A6FD12B1437D4BE9882F7C161AF3777B.description:
Apply grade 5 Viewing standards to informational texts
(e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence
to support particular points in a text, identifying which
reasons and evidence support which point[s].”).

B70BE4EBEBFA44589C7C8DCE480FC04A.description:
Apply grade 5 Viewing standards to literature (e.g., “Compare
and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a
story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g.,
how characters interact].”).

D6841887939848B08329731D7EC0C030.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

0FAB30F0BA674F53A1386CF6A9435EE1.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather
relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize
or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and
provide a list of sources.

99200C603E0041F2A6098ABCEDDA75D5.description:
Conduct short research projects that use several sources to
build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of
a topic.

3807C8369738410095F41FBBCA3DFF8C.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

388E8C3E09294341B96F7A4C37C36E2B.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology,
including the Internet, to produce and publish signing as
well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate
sufficient command of video editing skills to compose a
minimum of four minutes of video).

F750C6A926944A3C9A69F1EE1EE37563.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop
and strengthen signing as needed by planning, revising,
editing, re-signing, or trying a new approach. (Editing for
structure should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1-3 up to and including grade 5.)

1385B74E1A434FA7BAA4B56674723D97.description:
Produce clear and coherent signing in which the development
and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for signing types are
defined in standards 1-3 above.)

F22CAD5E687149CE8F933E2DB25D6A90.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

0493042074714B1CA9BAFE9457974153.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated
experiences or events.

7AC5534AE7604DC29B28176742E22E9B.description:
Use concrete signs and phrases and sensory details to
convey experiences and events precisely.

D8F8F43ED2E549A39147B28030558B66.description:
Use a variety of transitional signs, phrases, and clauses to
manage the sequence of events.

036EB18B594F45849CA10AB1B10CEDD0.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue (role-shifting),
description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events
or show the responses of characters to situations

25F3FB55731643B298E12CBCF2C61EB1.description:
Orient the viewer by establishing a situation and introducing
a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence

98D8C4E57FDC43EBA1FF959ADD903841.description:
Sign narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear
event sequences.

26A4CD161BDA426AAA35807436A1B70F.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section related to the
information or explanation presented.

CA86812A31B44275A9B497730D40A712.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic.

1D180E667E41480EBA5CA4BE229E74B4.description:
Link ideas within and across categories of information using
signs, phrases, and clauses (e.g., POINT, use contrastive
structure, conditionals).

176B415EA4C84B6AB4C5C47A85B17D50.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and examples related to
the topic.

4CE282ECBF9D4B3CBCA4287254B57A92.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation
and focus, and group related information logically; include
formatting (e.g., video transitions), illustrations, and
multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

0F02FC4150F949D0966187BCAF784A52.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas and information clearly.

11CEB4E9E60148DE92E6240614720149.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section related to the
opinion presented.

0113826829184EAEA90CB2C39A12B422.description:
Link opinion and reasons using signs, phrases, and clauses
(e.g., THEREFORE, HAPPEN, SPECIFICALLY).

C6BAA4DE8BCC4CF385D3D64F1CDA5A4A.description:
Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by
facts and details.

4246D715B4D34AA596F9CA863BB04512.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create
an organizational structure in which ideas are logically
grouped to support the signer’s purpose.

979E6E54ECEB465184D35FD2BB455FFA.description:
Sign opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of
view with reasons and information.

616B3E8818BD435C84F1363BAD8AE47E.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct sign recognition and
understanding, re-viewing as necessary.

703E8A638B5445F8B380EABA173A4EAF.description:
View and recite on-level text prose and poetry with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and expression on successive viewings for
both published and live texts.

21ABC3E2FE074BD3A090E1C51CD35158.description: View on-level text with purpose and understanding.

EEEC1C6C0B7C4596B21ECC0F4A724BF2.description:
View and sign on-level texts with sufficient accuracy and
fluency to support comprehension.

ADE6A95C70C549B8992D83B2973BB41D.description:
Use combined knowledge of all parameters and morphology
(e.g., roots, affixes, and depictions) to accurately decode
unfamiliar signs and phrases in context and out of context.

D7ACA775E2E74EA4B429A5376A5BE0E7.description:
Know and apply grade-level sign analysis skills in decoding
signs.

7B8463C3D2F24083A80A8A32E6D205EF.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend informational
texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical
texts, at the high end of the grades 4-5 text complexity band
independently and proficiently.

BDD219912536494BBCE2DB8FD58C9451.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

518CE025E4474020B319A1B84D2DDB6E.description:
Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in
order to narrate about the subject knowledgeably.

A3F7B17B6E5B4E84940231449B1A4804.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support
particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and
evidence support which point(s).

B1B9CA1EDFAB49DB921277A475F557A2.description:
Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources,
demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question
quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

8F5A795B6FA7497A94142CBB9716B9EB.description:
Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting
important similarities and differences in the point of view they
represent.

D7076F008A3E4B398B28CDBEE86AC55F.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology,
comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas,
concepts, or information in two or more texts.

7E9318E08BBC4D9CB51F3F62D52F01F6.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domainspecific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic
or subject area.

F2B6777E19CE4853B30B90DEAF5970D9.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more
individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific,
or technical text based on specific information in the text.

ED86A929AF2F49088732BAA788121F92.description:
Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how
they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

7B99E85B15164DB7B50FD8CC7E5B57CD.description:
Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text
says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

BB7C6A5D26694F3C8320306D66BA8514.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of
the grades 4–5 text complexity band independently and
proficiently.

891A3AA8A68344889B8A40B9152BD0B6.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

2234AAD8434E4E4B85BEB2E1940708C6.description:
Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g.,
mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar
themes and topics.

2515024E084F4676B71E5F6CED4F5EFB.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to
the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., cinematography,
multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

E465217D0C594E9290EDE1A1234DE4E1.description:
Describe how a narrator’s point of view influences how events
are described.

26EF3FF8487B4090B7CC02CFC1F1B895.description:
Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits
together to provide the overall structure of a particular story,
drama, or poem.

5D1D3383593A456F9DE20480D709823F.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are used
in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors,
similes, and hyperboles.

2CE04F152DA4462DAE46BF9C49C4EEA0.description:
Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or
events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the
text (e.g., how characters interact).

4CD3E5472E0948E89E3C92D0FDB96077.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in
the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond
to challenges or how the signer in a poem reflects upon a
topic; summarize the text.

C6564E4BD9404C76ABBAD0F77385EA08.description:
Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text
says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
